data.title: Ok
data.text: Food is good. No parking unless you run the risk of getting your car towed or ticketed. Kinda cramped.

data.title: budget Friendly
data.text: I eat here often since i work near.  They have good lunch specials everything always fresh because they are busy. Pizza is good and beef patties are even better.  My pockets and stomach love this place . Good eats

data.title: very good , Love it
data.text: The best Pizza in Paterson. Family oriented, very friendly and very clean place. their pizza in always consisting.

data.title: Most Authentic
data.text: My family has visited Ellison since I was 5 and it is absolutely the best pizza in town. Family run explaining the real wholesomeness of its food

data.title: Good Food
data.text: Good food & good service. Whenever I'm in the area & crave Italian food 8/10 times i patronize tis business.

data.title: Delicious piza
data.text:
Many customers were inside. 
I ordered vegetable pizza 😑(tomatoes, onion and cheese)
and it was so crispy.
And it is so cheap. I feel a little oily but worth to visit.

data.title: The best Pizza in Downtown Paterson
data.text: I work in Paterson and there are probably a dozen pizza places to choose from but Ellison is far and away the best.The service is fast and friendly and the plain pie is very good.But their speciality pies are excellent.My favorites are the bruchheta and the grilled chicken with bacon.The sub sandwiches are made on fresh italian bread and piled high unlike Subway or Blimpies.

data.title: Best Pizza in Paterson
data.text: Fast, friendly service and consistently great tasting pizza. They also deliver! Prices are very reasonable. Salads are fresh and huge. I would recommend anything on the menu. Their leftover pizza also reheats at home extremely well!

data.title: Best Pizza Ever
data.text:
Down a little side street, half a block off main is Ellison Pizza.     I would have missed it save the two cops sitting in the window eating lunch.    Figuring that they knew the area better than me I went it.    It is a classic, simple counter, simple tables and chairs and a bunch of old posters on the wall.

Easy to pass by...   But Dont.

Like everyone else, I have eaten a lot of pizza.   Bulldogs Sally's in New Haven; Paulie Gee's, Lucali, and Totonno's  in New York; and of course Pizzeria Da Nella and Mista Pizza in Chicago.

However I now have a new BEST PIZZA - 

Everything is fresh.    They can make anything, I was in a rush so I had two slices from the pie on the counter...    Tomato, onion, basil, garlic, and prosciutto.    AMAZING  Wow!!

They cut the tomatoes, onion, and garlic right before they place it in the oven.

In the area, stop by; not in the area - make it a trip - you will not be disappointed.

And the price, $6 for 2 large slices and a soda.   I am going back!!!!
